site_settings.venue_tagline: Where every horse lives like royalty and every rider falls off with dignity since 1987.
site_settings.address_street: Nags Rest Manor, 42 Muck Heap Lane
site_settings.security_info:
LAST PERSON LEAVING PROCEDURES

1. Turn off all lights (the horses prefer mood lighting but we can't afford it)
2. Check all tack room doors are locked (Thunderbolt the Cob has learned to open them)
3. Ensure all horses have water (Mr Snuffles tips his over for fun)
4. Close and bolt all stable doors (twice for Sir Kicks-A-Lot)
5. Check the feed room - if Barry Muckspreader left treats out, hide them
6. Turn off water heaters (unless you want another Great Flood of 2019)
7. Lock the main gate and pray the peacocks don't escape again

EMERGENCY CONTACTS

Yard Manager (Baroness Canter-Downhill): 07700 900100
'Definitely Not Dodgy' Dave the Farrier: 07700 800999
Valley Vets (ask for Dr. Hoofington): 07700 800001
Panic Stations (Fire/Police/Ambulance): 999

FIRE PROCEDURE

1. Raise the alarm - shout 'FIRE!' (not 'FREE CARROTS!' - we tried that)
2. Call 999 - address is Nags Rest Manor, Muck Heap Lane
3. Release horses from stables if safe (alphabetically - they get jealous)
4. Move horses to Far Paddock (the one WITHOUT the aggressive geese)
5. Do NOT attempt to fight fire yourself (remember Timothy and the hose incident)
6. Meet emergency services at main gate
7. Account for all horses, staff, and the yard cat (Lord Whiskers)

NOTE: If the fire is in the hay barn, we saw nothing. Insurance purposes.

15+.fully_clipped: Light sheet for the precious ones

arenas.name: Indoor Arena
arenas.description: Our main indoor arena offers all-weather riding with excellent footing. Perfect for flatwork, jumping, and lessons regardless of weather conditions. Features full-height mirrors on one side.

arenas.name: Outdoor Arena
arenas.description: Large outdoor arena with all-weather surface, ideal for schooling and jumping. Offers a more spacious feel and is perfect for preparing horses for outdoor competitions.

arenas.name: Grass Arena
arenas.description: Natural grass arena for those who prefer a traditional surface. Well-maintained and level, suitable for flatwork and light jumping. Best used in dry conditions.

arenas.name: Cross Country Course
arenas.description: Mini cross country course with a variety of natural and rustic fences suitable for training and schooling. Includes logs, ditches, steps, and water tray.

livery_packages.name: DIY Livery
livery_packages.description: Perfect for hands-on owners who want full control of their horse's care.
features: Daily turnout across 60 acres of post-and-rail paddocks
Use of indoor and outdoor arenas
Hot and cold wash bay with solarium
Hay and straw available to purchase
Feed storage in secure feed room
livery_packages.additional_note: You provide all feeds, hay, bedding, and undertake all daily care duties.

livery_packages.name: Part Livery
livery_packages.description: A popular choice offering a balance of professional care and personal involvement.
livery_packages.additional_note: You provide evening care at weekends and any specialist feeds or supplements.

livery_packages.name: Full Livery
livery_packages.description: Comprehensive care for owners with limited time or those who want complete peace of mind.
features: Full mucking out 7 days a week
livery_packages.additional_note: Additional services such as schooling, lunging, and competition preparation available.

livery_packages.name: Holiday Livery
livery_packages.description: Short-term accommodation for visiting horses. Perfect for holidays, competitions, or temporary stays.
livery_packages.additional_note: Minimum stay 3 nights. Billed per day based on weekly rate. Services such as exercise, lessons, and arena hire available at standard rates.

livery_packages.name: Rehab Livery
livery_packages.description: Specialist care for horses recovering from injury or surgery. Enhanced monitoring and tailored rehabilitation support.
features: Controlled exercise as per vet instructions
livery_packages.additional_note: Price includes £100/week rehabilitation care supplement over Full Livery. This supplement is typically covered by equine insurance policies. We provide detailed monthly statements for insurance claims.

horses.name: Shadowfax
horses.passport_name: Donavale's Lord of the Mearas III
horses.handling_notes: Perfect gentleman. Show me the way to Mordor and I'll gallop you there.

horses.name: Black Beauty
horses.farrier_notes: Dislikes having back feet handled. Needs patience and treats. Many treats.
horses.clipping_notes: Has opinions about clippers. Strong opinions. Very loud opinions.
horses.catching_notes: Pretends not to see you coming. Has a PhD in evasion tactics.
horses.vet_notes: Believes vets are part of a conspiracy. Extra time needed for all procedures.
horses.headshy_notes: Don't touch the ears. Seriously. He's writing another chapter about it.
horses.handling_notes: Has written an autobiography about his difficult childhood.

horses.name: Seabiscuit
horses.dentist_notes: Convinced the dentist is out to get him. Requires full sedation and possibly a therapist.
horses.vet_notes: Fine with vets. Mouth is a different story - approach from the side.
horses.sedation_notes: Has previously gone wobbly under sedation. Needs extra monitoring and a soft landing zone.
horses.handling_notes: Nips when hungry. Also when not hungry. Basically, just assume he'll nip.

horses.name: Spirit
horses.farrier_notes: Believes he should be running free with wild horses, not having his feet done.
horses.dentist_notes: Will absolutely not be tamed. By dentists or anyone else.
horses.clipping_notes: The clippers are his mortal enemy. They took everything from him.
horses.loading_notes: Loading requires a tribal ceremony and possibly an inspirational soundtrack.
horses.catching_notes: Will run free in the field like a majestic stallion. For hours. Bring snacks and a chair.
horses.vet_notes: Believes modern medicine is unnatural. Prefers ancient Native American remedies.
horses.tying_notes: MUST NOT BE TIED. Will pull back and fight it like freedom itself is at stake.
horses.headshy_notes: Head is a no-fly zone. Approach slowly, talk softly, bring carrots.
horses.handling_notes: Has strong independent spirit. Can be caught with grain and patience. Mostly grain.

horses.name: Hidalgo
horses.handling_notes: Will cross any desert for you. Or at least the outdoor school.

horses.name: Joey
horses.vet_notes: Bravest horse in the trenches. Has seen things. Will stand for anything.
horses.handling_notes: Best boy. Would cross no man's land for a polo mint. Doesn't hold grudges.

horses.name: Phoenix
horses.handling_notes: Currently recovering from a leg wound. Needs daily wound care. Very patient for treatments.

horses.name: Tempo
horses.handling_notes: On rehabilitation program after tendon injury. Walking exercise only - follow rehab plan strictly.

horses.name: Ginger
horses.handling_notes: Senior mare on daily joint supplements. Well-mannered and easy to handle. Regular monitoring for arthritis.

horses.name: Wanderlust
horses.handling_notes: Holiday livery guest. Sweet mare here for 2 weeks while owner attends local competitions. Easy to handle, good with other horses.

horses.name: Captain Comeback
horses.handling_notes: Rehab livery patient. Recovering from suspensory ligament injury. Staff-managed care plan. Captain is a perfect patient - stands like a statue for all treatments and has perfected the 'brave soldier' look.

notices.title: URGENT: Gate Code Changed
notices.content: The gate code has been changed. The new code is definitely NOT 1234. Please ask at the office because I've already forgotten what it is.

notices.title: Lost: One Marble
notices.content: Has anyone seen my marble? I seem to have lost it. Actually, I may have lost several. If found, please return to the office. Reward: A sense of satisfaction.

notices.title: Dressage Clinic Next Week
notices.content: Remember: In dressage, we don't gallop around like headless chickens. That's what the cross-country field is for. Sign up now!

notices.title: Wheelbarrow Race Championships
notices.content: Annual Wheelbarrow Race this Saturday! Categories: Fastest Muck Out, Most Creative Poo Pyramid, and Best Wheelbarrow Drift. Prizes include bragging rights and a slightly used rake.

notices.title: Please Don't Feed the Horses
notices.content: A reminder that horses are on special diets. Please don't feed them treats, especially not your sandwiches, crisps, or that suspicious casserole from last week's potluck.

notices.title: Farrier Visit Tomorrow
notices.content: Big Sam the Farrier is visiting tomorrow. Please ensure your horse is caught, clean, and hasn't learned any new swear words since last time.

notices.title: Show Jumping Clinic Cancelled
notices.content: Due to the jumps mysteriously relocating themselves overnight (the wind, obviously, definitely not the ponies), tomorrow's clinic is postponed until we can find them all.

notices.title: Coffee Machine Status: Critical
notices.content: The coffee machine in the tack room is making strange noises. Approach with caution. If it starts speaking Latin, please notify management immediately.

services.name: The Gentle Stroll (20 mins)
services.description: Hand walking for horses who think the field is too far. Perfect for your drama queen who claims they can't possibly walk that far without a rest.

services.name: The Full Workout (45 mins)
services.description: Extended exercise for horses who have more energy than sense. Includes lunging, long-reining, and explaining to them why running off is NOT acceptable.

services.name: Field-to-Stable Escort Service
services.description: For the horse who treats the walk from field to stable like a grand adventure. Includes handling their dramatic 'I've never seen that gate before' moments.

services.name: Basic Schooling (Flatwork Therapy)
services.description: Flatwork schooling session. We'll work on transitions, bending, and convincing your horse that the corner of the arena is not, in fact, haunted.
services.approval_reason: Staff availability must be confirmed - we need our best translator for horse-to-human negotiations

services.name: The Full Pamper (Spa Day)
services.description: Complete grooming including mane, tail, and removing evidence of whatever they rolled in this morning. Includes disapproving looks at mud stains.

services.name: The Quick Tidy
services.description: Emergency grooming for when the horse has decorated themselves in mud right before the vet/farrier/owner arrives. Panic-level service available.

services.name: Mane Plaiting (Show Ready)
services.description: Professional plaiting for shows. Includes repeatedly re-doing plaits after your horse rubs them out the moment you turn your back.

services.name: Rug Wrestling Service
services.description: Changing rugs for horses who have strong opinions about their wardrobe. We handle the dramatic sighing and 'I hate this one' performances.

services.name: Vet Visit Moral Support
services.description: Professional horse-holding during vet visits. Includes soothing words, strategic treat deployment, and acting like the thermometer isn't personal.
services.approval_reason: Need to coordinate with vet appointment

services.name: Farrier Visit Wrangling
services.description: Holding services for farrier visits. We'll distract your horse from their firmly-held belief that shoes are actually instruments of torture.
services.approval_reason: Need to coordinate with farrier visit

services.name: Poultice & Bandage Service
services.description: Expert poultice application and bandaging. Includes the inevitable 'I will remove this the moment you leave' prevention strategies.

services.name: Box Rest Companionship
services.description: Keeping your box-resting horse company so they don't lose their mind from boredom. Includes reading to them, chatting about the weather, and ignoring their escape attempts.

services.name: Worming Administration
services.description: Administration of worming paste. We'll hold their head, you provide the wormer. Includes the interpretive dance of trying to keep it in their mouth.

services.name: Rehab Exercise Assistance
services.description: Help with rehabilitation exercises for horses on recovery programs. Staff will perform the prescribed exercises while you're away - walking, controlled movement, or therapeutic routines.

services.name: Basic Rehab Care (Daily)
services.description: Essential daily monitoring for horses on box rest. Includes health check, medication administration, and vet liaison. Ideal for horses requiring rest with minimal intervention.
services.notes: Approx £60/week. Includes: daily health check, medication admin, temperature/vital monitoring, vet communication, daily progress notes.

services.name: Standard Rehab Care (Daily)
services.description: Comprehensive daily rehabilitation care including controlled exercise. Includes all Basic care plus hand-walking, controlled turnout, and wound care as needed.
services.notes: Approx £100/week. Includes all Basic care plus: hand-walking (as per vet instructions), controlled turnout in rehab paddock, wound care/dressing changes, detailed daily reports.

services.name: Intensive Rehab Care (Daily)
services.description: Full intensive rehabilitation support for horses requiring maximum care. Includes all Standard care plus physio exercises, multiple daily sessions, hydrotherapy coordination, and enhanced monitoring.
services.notes: Approx £150/week. Includes all Standard care plus: physio exercise assistance, multiple daily exercise sessions, ice/cold therapy, coordination with physio/vet visits, enhanced monitoring schedule.

professionals.booking_notes: Available Tuesdays and Fridays. Specialises in remedial shoeing.
Annual check-ups recommended. Sedation available if required.
24/7 emergency service available. Regular yard visits on Wednesdays.
Feed supplier. Delivery available Mondays and Thursdays. 10% discount for yard orders.

bookings.title: Horatio Withers - Jumping Practice (Happy to Share!)
Millicent Stirrup - Dressage Practice (Open to Share)

clinics.title: Dressage Fundamentals
clinics.description: A group clinic focusing on the basics of dressage for intermediate riders. We'll cover accurate transitions, correct bend, and improving your horse's way of going. Work together in groups of up to 4 riders.

clinics.title: Private Show Jumping Clinic
clinics.description: One-on-one jumping sessions tailored to your specific needs and goals. Perfect for riders wanting focused attention on their technique over fences.

clinics.title: Flatwork & Position Clinic
clinics.description: Choose between private lessons for intensive focus or join a small group session. Both options available throughout the day - perfect for all levels.

clinics.title: Cross-Country Preparation
clinics.description: Group training session focusing on cross-country skills. We'll work on confidence over varied terrain and natural obstacles.

clinics.title: Advanced Dressage Masterclass
clinics.description: Intensive dressage training for experienced riders. Focus on collection, extended gaits and lateral work.
clinics.admin_notes: Arena unavailable on this date due to scheduled maintenance.

clinics.title: Pole Work Workshop
clinics.description: Improve your horse's suppleness and your own accuracy with a variety of pole exercises.
clinics.admin_notes: Please consider moving to afternoon slot to avoid conflict with farrier visits.

clinics.title: Autumn Jumping Clinic
clinics.description: Build confidence over fences with progressive exercises. All levels welcome.
clinics.admin_notes: Cancelled due to poor weather forecast.

clinics.title: Winter Flatwork Series
clinics.description: A comprehensive flatwork clinic covering transitions, lateral work and improving your horse's way of going.

compliance_items.name: Public Liability Insurance
compliance_items.description: Public liability insurance covering venue operations and visitors

compliance_items.name: Fire Risk Assessment
compliance_items.description: Annual fire risk assessment for all buildings

compliance_items.name: Fire Extinguisher Service
compliance_items.description: Annual inspection and servicing of all fire extinguishers

compliance_items.name: PAT Testing - Electrical
compliance_items.description: Portable Appliance Testing for all electrical equipment

compliance_items.name: First Aid Kit Inspection
compliance_items.description: Quarterly check and restock of all first aid kits

compliance_items.name: Riding Hat Safety Checks
compliance_items.description: Inspection of hire riding hats for damage and standards compliance

compliance_items.name: Arena Surface Maintenance
compliance_items.description: Professional arena surface assessment and maintenance

compliance_items.name: Jump Equipment Inspection
compliance_items.description: Safety inspection of all jumping equipment and poles

compliance_items.name: Emergency Lighting Test
compliance_items.description: Monthly test of emergency lighting systems

compliance_items.name: Health & Safety Policy Review
compliance_items.description: Annual review and update of health & safety policies

coach_profiles.teaching_description: I specialise in building rider confidence and improving horse-rider partnerships. From beginners to competitors, I focus on correct position, effective aids, and developing a harmonious relationship with your horse.
coach_profiles.bio: BHS Stage 4 qualified instructor with over 15 years of teaching experience. Competed at regional level in dressage and show jumping. Passionate about helping riders of all levels achieve their goals.

lesson_requests.notes: Would like to work on lateral movements and transitions. Shadowfax tends to fall on the forehand.
Confidence building session. Beauty can be spooky in the indoor arena.
lesson_requests.coach_response: Happy to help with confidence building. Let's take it slow and build trust.

lesson_requests.notes: Want to work on grid work and course riding. Preparing for local show.
lesson_requests.coach_response: Great plan! We'll set up some grids and work on your approach.

lesson_requests.notes: General schooling session to improve way of going.
lesson_requests.coach_response: Good progress made on rhythm and relaxation.
Excellent session! Really seeing improvement in the half-halts.

lesson_requests.notes: I'm bringing my horse from another yard for a one-off jumping lesson. Mare is 15.2hh Irish Sport Horse.
Looking to improve my position and effectiveness of aids. Will be riding a loan horse.
Light schooling session for Ginger - nothing too strenuous due to her age.
lesson_requests.coach_response: Apologies, I'm not available on this date as I'm at a competition. Could we reschedule?
Lesson cancelled at owner's request due to unexpected personal circumstances.

lesson_requests.notes: Gentle schooling to keep Ginger supple. Taking it easy due to her arthritis.
lesson_requests.coach_response: Accepted! Will focus on gentle exercises to maintain flexibility without overdoing it.

yard_tasks.title: Houdini horse has escaped AGAIN
yard_tasks.description: Shadowfax has learned to open his stable door. Third time this week. He's currently grazing the car park and looking very pleased with himself.

yard_tasks.title: Water trough has become a duck pond
yard_tasks.description: A family of ducks has moved into the top field trough. The horses are not impressed with their new roommates. Need diplomatic relocation.

yard_tasks.title: Arena poo mountain expedition
yard_tasks.description: Morning arena apocalypse clean-up required. Looks like someone had a very productive session yesterday. Bring reinforcements.

yard_tasks.title: Check fire extinguishers haven't been used as scratching posts
yard_tasks.description: Annual safety check on all fire extinguishers. Last year we found one with suspicious teeth marks. Looking at you, Spirit.

yard_tasks.title: Shavings emergency - horses staging a comfort protest
yard_tasks.description: Running critically low on bedding. The horses have started giving us 'the look'. You know the one.

yard_tasks.title: Fence post doing the limbo
yard_tasks.description: Fence post near the gate has developed a concerning lean. Probably from horses using it as a bum-scratching post. Needs re-concreting before it fully commits to horizontal life.

yard_tasks.title: Tack room archaeological dig
yard_tasks.description: Monthly deep clean. Last time we found a bridle from 2019 and someone's lost coffee mug with its own ecosystem.

yard_tasks.title: Oiling squeaky stable doors (before the horses complain to HR)
yard_tasks.description: The stable doors are serenading us with their creaky song. Multiple horses have filed noise complaints via extended staring.

yard_tasks.title: Yard sweep - the never-ending battle
yard_tasks.description: Weekly sweep of main yard. Fighting entropy one pile of hay at a time. Sisyphus had it easy.

yard_tasks.title: First aid kit restock (humans and horses both accident-prone)
yard_tasks.description: Monthly check of medical supplies. Need more plasters - someone keeps using them as decorative stickers on their hard hat.

yard_tasks.title: Replace the wheelbarrow wheel of shame
yard_tasks.description: The yard's favourite wheelbarrow has finally given up the ghost. Wheel fell off dramatically during mucking out. Moment of silence.

yard_tasks.title: Untangle the hosepipe spaghetti
yard_tasks.description: Somehow the hosepipe has achieved sentience and tied itself in 47 knots. Might need an exorcist. Or just patience.

yard_tasks.title: Arena mirror needs de-misting spell
yard_tasks.description: One of the arena mirrors is so dirty the horses don't recognise themselves. Black Beauty spent 10 minutes trying to make friends with 'the new horse'.

yard_tasks.title: Fix the light that's been 'flickering for character'
yard_tasks.description: The barn light has been doing its best horror movie impression for weeks. Time to either fix it or embrace the atmosphere.

yard_tasks.title: Muck heap relocation consultation
yard_tasks.description: The muck heap has reached new heights. Mount Poopmore is affecting local weather patterns. Time to call in the skip.

yard_tasks.title: Cat has claimed the feed room - negotiate terms
yard_tasks.description: The yard cat has established a throne on the feed bags and refuses to move. Currently accepting treats as tribute.

yard_tasks.title: Replace the mysterious 'borrowed' broom
yard_tasks.description: The good broom has vanished. Again. There's a broom bermuda triangle somewhere on this yard.

yard_tasks.title: Fix the gate that only opens with interpretive dance
yard_tasks.description: The paddock gate requires a specific sequence of lifts, jiggles, and whispered encouragement to open. Not ideal when leading a spooky horse.

yard_tasks.title: Replace broken wheelbarrow wheel
yard_tasks.description: The big blue wheelbarrow has a flat tyre. Already ordered replacement.

yard_tasks.title: Paint the tack room door
yard_tasks.description: The tack room door needs repainting - looking scruffy.

yard_tasks.title: Review monthly feed supplier invoice
yard_tasks.description: Check this month's delivery matches the invoice. Compare quantities with what we actually received.

yard_tasks.title: Approve new livery client paperwork
yard_tasks.description: Sarah's joining with her mare next week. Need to finalise the contract and stable allocation.

yard_tasks.title: Call insurance company re: policy renewal
yard_tasks.description: Policy expires end of month. Need to confirm coverage levels and get renewal quote.

yard_tasks.title: Morning stables checked and water topped up
yard_tasks.description: All stables inspected, water buckets filled, haynets checked.

yard_tasks.title: Horses turned out to fields
yard_tasks.description: All livery horses successfully turned out to designated paddocks.

yard_tasks.title: Morning feeds given
yard_tasks.description: All horses received morning feeds as per their schedules.

yard_tasks.title: Indoor arena harrowed
yard_tasks.description: Arena surface harrowed and watered ready for morning lessons.

yard_tasks.title: Turn out Shadowfax to Top Field
yard_tasks.description: Morning turnout - check rug is secure and water trough is full.

yard_tasks.title: Turn out Black Beauty to Bottom Paddock
yard_tasks.description: Morning turnout - companion is Seabiscuit. Gate needs lifting to close.

yard_tasks.title: Bring in Spirit for farrier visit
yard_tasks.description: Farrier coming at 2pm. Spirit needs to be in and dry with clean feet.

yard_tasks.title: Rug change for Hidalgo
yard_tasks.description: Weather turning cold tonight - swap to medium weight rug before turnout.

yard_tasks.title: Evening feeds - all horses
yard_tasks.description: Prepare and distribute evening feeds per feed board. Check water buckets.

yard_tasks.title: Soak hay for Seabiscuit
yard_tasks.description: Hay needs 30 min soak before feeding - respiratory issues.

yard_tasks.title: Extra hay net for Black Beauty
yard_tasks.description: Owner requested extra hay tonight - horse lost weight recently.

yard_tasks.title: Collect horses from field - afternoon
yard_tasks.description: Bring in all field horses before dark. Check for any injuries.

yard_tasks.title: Lunge Spirit for livery2
yard_tasks.description: 20 mins each rein, walk and trot only. Owner can't make it today.

yard_tasks.title: Prepare stable for new arrival
yard_tasks.description: Deep bed with fresh shavings, full water bucket, small hay net.

yard_tasks.title: Check field fencing after storm
yard_tasks.description: High winds last night - check all paddock fencing is secure before turnout.

feed_schedules.morning_feed: 2 scoops Allen & Page Calm & Condition, handful of chaff
feed_schedules.evening_feed: 2 scoops Allen & Page Calm & Condition, handful of chaff, small slice of hay
feed_schedules.supplements: NAF Five Star Magic calmer (1 scoop AM), Global Herbs Laminitis Prone (1 scoop PM)
feed_schedules.special_instructions: Easy keeper - no extra hay. Check weight tape weekly.

feed_schedules.morning_feed: 3 scoops Spillers Conditioning Cubes, apple, large helping chaff
feed_schedules.evening_feed: 3 scoops Spillers Conditioning Cubes, carrot, hay ad lib
feed_schedules.supplements: Equine America Cortaflex (30ml AM), Nupafeed MAH Calmer (1 scoop both feeds)
feed_schedules.special_instructions: Fussy eater - mix supplements well. Prefers warm water on feed in winter.

feed_schedules.morning_feed: 2 scoops TopSpec Lite, handful of speedibeet (soaked)
feed_schedules.evening_feed: 2 scoops TopSpec Lite, speedibeet, hay net
feed_schedules.supplements: NAF Superflex (1 scoop PM) for joints
feed_schedules.supply_notes: Running low on speedibeet - owner aware, bringing more Thursday

feed_schedules.morning_feed: 1 scoop high fibre nuts, large handful chaff, soaked hay
feed_schedules.evening_feed: 1 scoop high fibre nuts, chaff, steamed hay
feed_schedules.special_instructions: WEIGHT WATCHING - limit hay, use small-hole net. No treats from visitors.

feed_schedules.morning_feed: 2 scoops TopSpec Comprehensive, handful of chaff, splash of oil
feed_schedules.evening_feed: Owner provides - usually 1 scoop conditioning cubes
feed_schedules.supplements: NAF Glucosamine (1 scoop AM) for joints
feed_schedules.special_instructions: Desert endurance horse - loves to drink! Ensure water bucket topped up after feeds.

feed_schedules.morning_feed: 2 scoops Alfa-A Original, 1 scoop conditioning mix, chopped apple
feed_schedules.evening_feed: Owner provides - hay and basic nuts
feed_schedules.supplements: Feedmark Steady-Up (AM) for focus, Global Herbs RigCalm (PM)
feed_schedules.special_instructions: Very food motivated. Will perform tricks for treats. Keep a straight face during dinner theatre.
feed_schedules.supply_notes: Running low on Alfa-A - owner notified, will bring more this weekend

feed_supply_alerts.notes: Running very low - maybe 2 days left. Owner notified via text.

turnout_requests.notes: Can go out with Beauty as usual. Please use grazing muzzle.
turnout_requests.response_message: Approved - will turn out after morning feeds.

turnout_requests.notes: Keeping in tomorrow - vet visit at 11am for vaccinations.
turnout_requests.response_message: Noted - will keep in with hay net.

turnout_requests.notes: Can go out alone or with any quiet gelding. NOT with mares.
Please keep in - farrier coming at 2pm.
Back to normal turnout after vet visit.
Please put out for the whole day.
turnout_requests.response_message: Unfortunately all fields are waterlogged due to heavy rain. No turnout available until further notice.

holiday_requests.reason: Beach holiday in Magaluf. Desperately need to top up the tan before winter sets in.
holiday_requests.approval_notes: Enjoy! Try not to fall off any balconies.

holiday_requests.reason: Dentist appointment that I've been putting off for 6 months
My sister's wedding. Someone has to keep the embarrassing speeches under control.
Trip to Thailand. Going to find myself (and hopefully some decent pad thai).
holiday_requests.approval_notes: Approved - casual staff can cover. Bring back snacks!

holiday_requests.reason: Want to take two weeks off for Christmas and New Year
holiday_requests.approval_notes: Sorry, we can't spare you for that long over Christmas - it's our busiest time. Can approve 5 days instead?

holiday_requests.reason: Concert tickets - once in a lifetime opportunity!

unplanned_absences.notes: Food poisoning from the dodgy kebab after pub quiz. Rookie error.
Called in sounding like death warmed up. Coincidentally the morning after the village pub's birthday bash.
Nasty cold doing the rounds. Sneezing on horses not recommended.
Just didn't turn up. Forgot to check the rota apparently. Blame the Monday brain.
Dad had a fall, needed to help mum. Sorted now thankfully.

service_requests.special_instructions: Light exercise only - just back from a few days rest.
Full groom including mane plaiting - show tomorrow!
Include 20 mins turnout in small paddock if weather permits.
Lunge only - she can be strong to lead.
Working on lateral work. Use indoor arena if available.
Please swap to lightweight turnout rug - he's been getting sweaty under current one.
Quick brush off before owner arrives at 4pm. She's rolled in mud AGAIN.
Please bring in by 3pm - farrier coming at 4pm.
Annual vaccinations. Vet booked for 10am. He's fine with needles but a bit mouthy.
Animalintex poultice on near fore - minor sole bruise. Change daily for 3 days.
Dressage plaits please - competition on Sunday.
20 minute walk and trot. He was very good.
Full groom before owner's visit.
She was surprisingly well behaved. Only tried to bite the farrier twice.
service_requests.notes: Farrier appointment - Big Sam. Spirit was actually quite good!

service_requests.special_instructions: Quick brush off - looked like he'd had a mud spa.
Box rest day 3 - keep him company. Read him some poetry.
service_requests.notes: Spent an hour with Beauty. He seems much happier now. Enjoyed the poetry reading.

service_requests.special_instructions: Light walking only - still recovering from leg injury. Follow vet instructions.
Use Equest Pramox from medicine cabinet
Changed my mind - will do it myself tomorrow.
Please do Tempo's morning walk (15 mins) - I'm stuck at work. Follow the rehab program instructions!
Morning walk and cold hosing for Tempo. He'll try to convince you trotting is fine - it's not!
Morning walk and cold hosing for Tempo. He'll try to convince you trotting is fine - it's not!
Morning walk and cold hosing for Tempo. He'll try to convince you trotting is fine - it's not!
Afternoon walk for Tempo - owner away at a show.
service_requests.notes: Tempo was surprisingly well-behaved today. Only tried to trot twice. Cold hosing done, he pretended to hate it as usual.

service_requests.special_instructions: Phoenix needs his morning walk (10 mins) - I'm at work all day. He's been good but will try for extra treats!

service_requests.quote_notes: Daily walking exercise plus wound check. Standard rate for rehab assistance.
service_requests.special_instructions: Phoenix morning walk AND wound check please - I'll be at a conference for 3 days.
Afternoon walk for Phoenix - I'm stuck in traffic!
service_requests.notes: Phoenix was a star. Walked nicely, didn't try to trot. Wound looking good, no swelling.

service_requests.special_instructions: Morning walk and wound cream for Phoenix. Working late today.
service_requests.notes: Phoenix enjoyed his walk. Applied wound cream - he was very brave about it. Extra carrot given for being good.

timesheets.notes: Morning feeds, mucking out. Helped with new delivery of shavings.
Standard morning shift. Had to chase Spirit around the field for 20 minutes.
Afternoon and evening feeds. Gave Shadowfax his supplements.
Helped set up for the weekend clinic. Moved jumps in indoor arena.
Busy day - deep cleaned three stables. My arms are still aching.
Evening feeds and turnout. All horses settled nicely.
Fixed the broken fence rail in paddock 3. Proper job this time!
Clocked out wrong time - should be 17:00 not 15:00.
timesheets.rejection_reason: Clock out time looks incorrect - you were definitely here until 5pm. Please correct and resubmit.

timesheets.notes: Forgot to log break. Took 45 mins.
timesheets.rejection_reason: Break time seems short for an 8.5 hour shift. Did you take a proper lunch? Please update if needed.

timesheets.notes: Evening shift. Beautiful sunset while bringing horses in.
Half day - morning feeds and turnout only.

fields.name: Top Paddock
fields.description: Large grass paddock with excellent drainage. Best field for turnout.

fields.name: Bottom Field
fields.description: Slightly boggy in winter but good summer grazing. Watch for escaped sheep.
fields.condition_notes: Sheep have been getting through the hedge again. Fixed temporary fencing.

fields.name: Mare's Meadow
fields.description: Quiet paddock away from the road. Good for nervous horses or mares with foals.

fields.name: The Strip
fields.description: Long narrow paddock along the lane. Good for individual turnout or rehabilitation walking.

fields.name: Sheep-Free Zone
fields.description: The only paddock the sheep haven't figured out how to invade. Yet.

fields.name: Recovery Paddock
fields.description: Small paddock near the yard for horses on box rest or limited turnout.

emergency_contacts.name: Dr. Emily Stethoscope
emergency_contacts.notes: Ring main number first, they have 24hr coverage

emergency_contacts.name: Bob 'Eventually' McHammer
emergency_contacts.availability_notes: Says he'll be there 9am. Actually arrives sometime between 11am and next Thursday. Excellent work though, when he finally shows up.
emergency_contacts.notes: Always add at least 3 hours to any estimated arrival time. Bring snacks for the wait.

emergency_contacts.name: Gerald Gallop (Husband)
emergency_contacts.notes: Call if Felicity is unreachable. He knows where her horse insurance documents are.

emergency_contacts.name: Dave 'Definitely Tuesday' Shoes
emergency_contacts.availability_notes: Will confirm Tuesday. Will actually turn up Friday. Or possibly the following Tuesday. Time is a construct to farriers.
emergency_contacts.notes: Book him 2 weeks before you actually need him. Expect him 3 weeks after that.

emergency_contacts.name: Sandra 'Sharp at Nine' Ironfoot
emergency_contacts.availability_notes: Actually arrives on time! We didn't know this was possible for farriers. Treasure her.
emergency_contacts.notes: The unicorn of farriers - punctual AND does great work. Don't tell the other farriers.

horse_companions.notes: Best friends. Pine for each other when separated. It's adorable and slightly codependent.
Get along fine, happily share a field without drama.
Do NOT turn out together. Shadowfax becomes territorial. Joey responds by being even more annoying. It escalates.

ledger_entries.description: Rug wash and reproof x2 - Thunderbolt's winter rugs
ledger_entries.notes: Sheep had got into the field and left 'presents' on the rugs. Again.

ledger_entries.description: Emergency fence repair - Prancer's escape attempt
ledger_entries.notes: The sheep showed him how to get out. Solidarity with the woolly ones.

ledger_entries.description: Sheep damage repair contribution - shared field incident
ledger_entries.notes: The Great Sheep Invasion of January '25. Damages split between affected liveries.

ledger_entries.description: Extra bedding - Chester's stable decoration hobby
ledger_entries.notes: Chester likes to redecorate his stable. Frequently. Costs extra shavings.
Stardust was NOT impressed. She expressed her displeasure vocally.

ledger_entries.description: Emergency call-out contribution - Sunday sheep roundup
ledger_entries.notes: Neighbour's entire flock invaded during Sunday lunch. All hands on deck. Pizza ordered for helpers.

farrier_records.work_done: Full set of shoes, front and back
Full set of shoes - needed extra patience with back feet
farrier_records.notes: Required extra time due to reluctance with hind feet

farrier_records.work_done: Full set of shoes, front and back

farrier_records.notes: Prefers natural hoof care, excellent feet

farrier_records.work_done: Full set of shoes with studs
Full set of shoes, front and back
Trim only - currently barefoot due to injury
farrier_records.notes: Will assess shoeing needs after wound has healed

farrier_records.work_done: Full set of shoes, light plates for dressage
Trim and front shoes only - remedial shoeing for arthritis support
farrier_records.notes: Using wider web shoes for extra support on front feet
Holiday livery - owner requested standard shoes
Heart bar shoes fitted as part of rehab programme

dentist_records.notes: Excellent dental health, no issues found
Headshy - took extra time but managed without sedation

dentist_records.treatment: Full exam under sedation - rasp and wolf tooth removal
dentist_records.notes: Required sedation as per handling notes. Wolf teeth extracted.
Sedation required. Good teeth, minor sharp edges

dentist_records.treatment: Routine rasp and check. Minor sharp edges removed.
dentist_records.notes: Good dental health for age. Monitor for wave mouth.
Part of rehab assessment - checking for dental-related discomfort issues

vaccination_records.notes: Holiday livery - owner requested annual flu/tet
Rehab horse - all vaccinations up to date
Strangles vaccination as precaution during rehab

worming_records.notes: High count - treatment administered with Equest
High count - treatment administered with Strongid P
High count - treatment administered with Panacur
High count - treatment administered with Panacur
High count - treatment administered with Panacur
High count - treatment administered with Strongid P
High count - treatment administered with Ivermectin
High count - treatment administered with Equest Pramox
Low count but treated as precaution given age
Low count - monitored closely during rehab
Prior to rehab admission - treated immediately

weight_records.notes: Spring check - slight loss after winter
Slight weight loss due to injury

body_condition_records.notes: Slight fat deposits over ribs - reduce hard feed
Thin through the back - increase feed
Overweight - needs exercise and diet plan

saddle_fit_records.notes: All good - weight gain hasn't affected fit
Western saddle - less frequent checks needed
Tree too narrow - recommend new saddle with wider tree
New saddle fitted - MW tree, excellent fit
Weight gain affecting fit - diet needed
Weight loss program affecting back shape - will need ongoing adjustments
Muscle wastage from injury - recheck as rehab progresses

feed_additions.name: Bute (Phenylbutazone)
feed_additions.reason: Pain management for leg wound healing

feed_additions.name: Cortaflex Joint Supplement
feed_additions.reason: Ongoing joint support for arthritis management

wound_care_logs.wound_location: Left hind leg, lateral cannon bone
wound_care_logs.wound_description: Approx 8cm laceration from field injury. Clean edges, no bone involvement.
wound_care_logs.treatment_given: Initial clean and debridement by vet. Flush with saline, apply Dermisol cream, bandage.
wound_care_logs.products_used: Saline solution, Dermisol cream, Melolin pad, Gamgee, Vetwrap
wound_care_logs.assessment_notes: Wound looking clean. Good granulation starting.

wound_care_logs.wound_location: Left hind leg, lateral cannon bone
wound_care_logs.treatment_given: Daily clean and redress. Wound looking better, less swelling.
wound_care_logs.products_used: Saline solution, Dermisol cream, Melolin pad, Gamgee, Vetwrap
wound_care_logs.assessment_notes: Reduced swelling, good progress. Edges starting to knit.

wound_care_logs.wound_location: Left hind leg, lateral cannon bone
wound_care_logs.treatment_given: Continued daily care. Reduced bandaging frequency as advised by vet.
wound_care_logs.products_used: Saline solution, Silver spray, Light bandage
wound_care_logs.assessment_notes: Excellent progress. Moving to every other day bandage changes.

wound_care_logs.wound_location: Left hind leg, lateral cannon bone
wound_care_logs.assessment_notes: Nearly healed. Vet visit tomorrow for sign-off.

health_observations.concerns: Slightly subdued following injury yesterday. Ate half breakfast.
health_observations.action_taken: Vet called to assess wound. Given bute for pain.

health_observations.concerns: Slightly stiff on left hind coming out of stable this morning
health_observations.action_taken: Owner notified. Will monitor. Normal after warmup.
Completed AM walking exercise as per rehab plan

rehab_programs.name: Operation Leg-endary Recovery
rehab_programs.description: 4-week controlled exercise program following superficial digital flexor tendon strain. Tempo must learn that he is NOT Usain Bolt.
rehab_programs.reason: SDFT strain diagnosed via ultrasound - mild to moderate damage. Patient decided to recreate the Grand National in his field.
rehab_programs.prescribed_by: Valley Vets - Dr. Emma Thompson (she's seen it all before)
rehab_programs.notes: Strict box rest when not exercising. Tempo has been caught trying to persuade other horses to help him escape. Cold hosing twice daily - he secretly enjoys it but pretends to hate it.

phases.name: Week 1-2: The Slow and Furious
phases.description: Controlled walking to maintain movement without stress. Yes Tempo, this IS actually walking.

tasks.description: Walk in hand for 10 minutes (actual walking, not prancing)
tasks.instructions: Keep to a slow, steady walk. Tempo will try to convince you he needs to trot 'for safety'. He does not.
tasks.equipment_needed: Headcollar, leadrope, and nerves of steel

tasks.description: Cold hose affected leg for 10 minutes
tasks.instructions: Run cold water over lower leg from knee down. Tempo will sigh dramatically. This is normal.
1 syringe of Bute paste orally. Tempo knows how to hold his breath for an impressive amount of time.

phases.name: Week 2-3: The Walking Dead (Slow Edition)
phases.description: Gradually increase walking duration. Still no running.

tasks.instructions: Maintain steady walk. May include gentle inclines. Tempo may negotiate for hills - stand firm.
tasks.equipment_needed: Headcollar, leadrope, and a firm 'no' ready

tasks.description: Cold spa treatment for fancy leg
tasks.instructions: Continue cold hosing once daily. Monitor for heat. Tempo will pretend the water is too cold even in summer.
Carefully flex and extend the affected leg. Tempo thinks this is an excellent opportunity to lean on you.

phases.name: Week 3-4: The Saddle Returns
phases.description: Begin light ridden work at walk only. Tempo's rider has been warned.

tasks.instructions: Light rider only. Walk on a long rein. Tempo will suggest a 'light canter' - decline politely but firmly.
tasks.equipment_needed: Saddle, bridle, boots, and high-visibility jacket in case he bolts

tasks.instructions: Circular massage around affected area. Tempo will fall asleep. Try not to let him lean on you.

rehab_programs.name: Phoenix Rising (Again)
rehab_programs.description: 3-week graduated return to exercise following leg laceration. Phoenix is determined to prove he really CAN rise from any setback.
rehab_programs.reason: Left hind cannon bone laceration - healing well, vet cleared for controlled exercise. Phoenix tried to befriend a fence post. The fence post won.
rehab_programs.notes: Monitor wound daily during exercise. Phoenix is being very brave about the whole thing and has only tried to lick his bandage off 47 times.

phases.name: Week 1: The Limp of Champions
phases.description: Short walks to maintain circulation without stressing healing tissue

tasks.instructions: Slow, steady walk. Phoenix will try to look pathetic for treats. Resist.
tasks.equipment_needed: Headcollar, leadrope, protective boots on other legs

tasks.description: Inspect wound and redress if needed
tasks.instructions: Check for signs of reopening, infection or swelling. Phoenix pretends it doesn't hurt but will milk it for extra carrots.
Gently apply cream to wound edges. Phoenix has been practicing his 'brave face'. It's adorable.

phases.name: Week 2: The Great Outdoors (Limited Edition)
phases.description: Longer walks and short periods of controlled turnout

tasks.instructions: Can include gentle hills. Phoenix will pretend he's fully recovered by the second lap.
Small, flat paddock only. Phoenix may try to convince you he needs 'just a little gallop'. He does not.

tasks.description: Monitor leg for heat and swelling
tasks.instructions: Run hands down leg comparing to others. Phoenix enjoys the attention more than necessary.

phases.name: Week 3: The Triumphant Return
phases.description: Begin ridden work at walk with gradual introduction of trot

tasks.instructions: Walk work in arena. Phoenix will try to trot. Redirect patiently.
tasks.equipment_needed: Saddle, bridle, brushing boots all round

tasks.description: Introduce 5 minutes trot (from day 3 of phase)
tasks.instructions: Rising trot only. Phoenix will try to canter. He's enthusiastic, bless him.
tasks.equipment_needed: Saddle, bridle, brushing boots all round

rehab_programs.name: Operation Spirit Level
rehab_programs.description: 6-week intensive program to address mysterious intermittent lameness. Spirit claims nothing is wrong and this is all a conspiracy.
rehab_programs.reason: Intermittent right fore lameness - suspected early navicular changes. Spirit believes he's fine and the vet is simply 'out to get him'.
rehab_programs.prescribed_by: Advanced Equine Clinic - Dr. James Herriot Jr.
rehab_programs.notes: Program paused because Spirit has decided to go on strike. He's not lame anymore but refuses to participate out of principle. Negotiations ongoing. Currently accepting carrot-based bribes.

phases.name: Week 1-2: The Suspiciously Cooperative Phase
phases.description: Complete rest with daily medication. Spirit behaved too well. We were suspicious.

tasks.instructions: Mix powder into feed. Spirit will pretend not to notice it in his feed even though he definitely notices.
Spirit will dramatically shake his mane at this indignity. Ignore the theatrics.

phases.name: Week 3-4: The 'Are You Sure?' Phase
phases.description: Controlled walking. Spirit questioned every instruction.

tasks.instructions: Spirit will try to run free. Do not be fooled by his 'wild mustang' act.
tasks.equipment_needed: Sturdy headcollar (he breaks the cheap ones)

tasks.description: Carrot stretches for neck and back
tasks.instructions: Spirit loves carrot stretches because they involve carrots. The stretching is secondary in his opinion.
Still pretending not to notice. Still definitely notices.

phases.name: Week 5-6: The Rebellion (Currently Paused)
phases.description: Introduce light work. Spirit had other plans.

tasks.description: Lunge at walk for 10 minutes each rein
tasks.instructions: Spirit believes lunging is beneath his dignity. Results may vary.
tasks.equipment_needed: Lunge line, cavesson, hard hat (for handler)

tasks.instructions: Must be alone. Will attempt to jump out if friends are nearby.
tasks.equipment_needed: High-visibility jacket to spot where he's gone

rehab_programs.name: Ginger's Golden Years Arthritis Management
rehab_programs.description: Ongoing maintenance program for senior mare with arthritis. Ginger says she's not old, she's 'vintage'.
rehab_programs.reason: Age-related osteoarthritis in both hocks. Ginger would like everyone to know she's still got it.
rehab_programs.notes: Program completed successfully! Ginger has proven that age is just a number. She's moving better than some of the youngsters and won't let anyone forget it.

phases.name: Week 1-3: The 'I'm Fine, Really' Phase
phases.description: Establish baseline and begin supplement regime

tasks.instructions: Ginger takes her supplements like a lady. With dignity. And polo mints after.
Ginger sets the pace. She's earned it.

phases.name: Week 4-6: The Comeback Phase
phases.description: Gradually increase activity as joints warm up

tasks.description: Walk and trot work on soft surface
tasks.instructions: Ginger will remind you she was doing this before you were born.
tasks.equipment_needed: Patience and respect for your elders

tasks.instructions: Ginger knows the routine by now.
Ginger will lean into this. A lot. Have stable footing.

phases.name: Week 7-9: The 'Still Got It' Phase
phases.description: Light ridden work

tasks.instructions: Light work. Ginger knows more than her rider.
The routine continues.

phases.name: Week 10-12: The Victory Lap
phases.description: Maintenance and celebration

tasks.instructions: Ginger is back in action. She wants everyone to know.
For life now. Ginger has come to terms with this.

rehab_programs.name: Operation Drama Queen
rehab_programs.description: 2-week program for mild muscle strain. Black Beauty is convinced this is the end. It is not.
rehab_programs.reason: Mild gluteal muscle strain after excessive dramatic bolting from a plastic bag. The bag was not a threat.
rehab_programs.notes: Black Beauty has already written the first chapter of his autobiography about this traumatic event. Working title: 'The Bag That Changed Everything'.

phases.name: Week 1: The Sympathy Phase
phases.description: Rest and anti-inflammatory treatment

tasks.instructions: 1 sachet morning, 1 sachet evening. Mix in with feed. Black Beauty will act like you're poisoning him. You're not.

tasks.description: Apply heat pack to affected muscle
tasks.instructions: Black Beauty will initially protest, then fall asleep. The cycle of drama.
Distinguish between actual pain and theatrical sighing. It's an art form.

phases.name: Week 2: The Reluctant Recovery
phases.description: Gentle return to movement

tasks.instructions: Black Beauty will limp dramatically. Check both sides - he forgets which leg was 'injured'.
Carrot stretches to the side. Black Beauty will need to be convinced the stretches aren't a trap.
tasks.equipment_needed: Many carrots (bribery budget may be exceeded)

tasks.instructions: Alone. Away from plastic bags. No, there are no plastic bags. Yes, we checked.

rehab_programs.name: The Great Dental Recovery
rehab_programs.description: Post dental surgery recovery program. Seabiscuit had 2 teeth removed and wants everyone to know about it.
rehab_programs.reason: Extraction of 2 severely worn molars. Seabiscuit is being prescribed soft feed and sympathy.
rehab_programs.notes: Program cancelled early as Seabiscuit recovered faster than expected. He was eating his normal hard feed within 2 weeks despite being told to take it easy. Patient compliance: nonexistent. Recovery: complete anyway.

phases.name: Week 1: The Soft Food Phase
phases.description: Soft mash diet only

tasks.instructions: Soaked feed cubes made into mash. Seabiscuit will look at it with disgust then eat the lot.
Seabiscuit will NOT open his mouth willingly. Bring backup.
Syringe directly into mouth. Seabiscuit considers this a personal betrayal every single time.

phases.name: Week 2-3: The Transition Phase (Cancelled)
phases.description: Gradual return to normal feed

tasks.instructions: 50/50 mix. Seabiscuit will pick out the hard bits first because rules don't apply to him.
Watch for quidding or dropping food. Seabiscuit drops food anyway. It's his thing.

phases.name: Week 4: The 'I'm Fine' Phase (Never Started)
phases.description: Return to normal feeding

tasks.instructions: Back to normal. Seabiscuit already got there without permission.

rehab_programs.name: Joey's Confidence Building Program
rehab_programs.description: Behavioral rehabilitation program to build confidence after a scary trailer incident. Joey is the bravest horse we know - he just forgot temporarily.
rehab_programs.reason: Developed loading anxiety after trailer breakdown on motorway. Joey was very brave about it but would prefer not to repeat the experience.
rehab_programs.notes: Joey is making excellent progress. He now approaches the trailer with only mild suspicion rather than full evacuation procedures. We celebrate small victories.

phases.name: Week 1: The 'What Trailer?' Phase
phases.description: Reintroduce trailer from a safe distance

tasks.instructions: Feed bucket placed progressively closer to trailer. Joey will pretend the trailer doesn't exist. This is progress.
In-hand grazing near trailer. Joey will graze with one eye permanently on the 'threat'.

phases.name: Week 2: The Investigation Phase
phases.description: Encourage interaction with trailer

tasks.description: Walk up to and touch trailer
tasks.instructions: Let Joey investigate at his own pace. He will sniff it suspiciously. Many times.
tasks.equipment_needed: Treats, patience, a complete lack of schedule

tasks.instructions: Place feed on ramp. Joey will eventually decide food is worth the risk. Because he's brave.

phases.name: Week 3: The Hokey Cokey Phase
phases.description: Practice loading and unloading

tasks.instructions: Joey goes in, Joey goes out. In, out, in, out. Shake it all about (optional).
tasks.equipment_needed: Treats, calm voice, possibly a supportive equine companion watching

tasks.instructions: Build up to full loading. Joey will look like he's memorizing escape routes. He is.
tasks.equipment_needed: Trailer with open front window for reassurance

tasks.instructions: After any successful loading: treats, scratches, verbal praise, possibly a parade in his honor.

phases.name: Week 4: The Graduation
phases.description: Short trailer journeys

tasks.instructions: Very short trips. Driver must avoid all motorways, scary roads, and anything resembling the previous incident.
tasks.equipment_needed: Trailer, calm driver, travel boots, many treats

tasks.instructions: Joey has earned all the treats. He would cross no man's land for us, and he's proving it again.
tasks.equipment_needed: Grooming kit, treats, possibly a medal

rehab_programs.name: Operation Captain's Return
rehab_programs.description: Comprehensive 12-week suspensory ligament rehabilitation program. Staff-managed intensive care with controlled exercise progression.
rehab_programs.reason: Proximal suspensory desmitis (hind limb). Diagnosed via ultrasound and nerve blocks. Captain is determined to make a full recovery and has been exceptionally cooperative.
rehab_programs.prescribed_by: Advanced Equine Sports Medicine - Dr. Alexandra Sterling
rehab_programs.notes: Full staff-managed rehabilitation - all tasks performed by yard staff as part of Rehab Livery package. Owner (Victoria) receives weekly progress reports. Captain is being an absolute star - stands perfectly for all treatments and seems to understand this is for his own good. Insurance claim in progress for care supplements.

phases.name: Weeks 1-4: Strict Controlled Exercise
phases.description: Box rest with controlled hand walking. Focus on maintaining condition without stressing the healing ligament.
phases.completion_notes: Phase completed successfully. Ultrasound shows good fiber alignment. Captain remained calm throughout box rest - a credit to his temperament.

tasks.instructions: Slow, controlled walk on firm level ground. Captain walks beautifully - no rushing or silliness.
tasks.equipment_needed: Headcollar, lead rope, brushing boots all round

tasks.description: Apply ice boots to affected hind limb
tasks.instructions: Ice boots for 20 minutes post-exercise. Captain stands like a statue. Staff nickname: 'The Captain's Easy'.
Add joint supplement to morning feed. Captain eats it without question.
Check for heat, swelling, or pain response. Document any changes. Captain allows thorough examination.
Full groom to maintain coat condition during box rest. Captain enjoys this and it keeps him mentally stimulated.

phases.name: Weeks 5-8: Progressive Loading
phases.description: Gradually increase walking duration and introduce slight inclines. Building tendon strength carefully.

tasks.instructions: Week 5-6: 15 mins. Week 7-8: 20 mins. Can include gentle inclines by week 7. Captain remains perfectly behaved.
tasks.equipment_needed: Headcollar, lead rope, brushing boots all round

tasks.instructions: Reduced to once daily. Continue monitoring for any heat post-exercise.
Small, flat paddock. Individual turnout only. Captain is sensible but no risks at this stage.
Carrot stretches and gentle pole work at walk. Building supporting musculature.
Applied to suspensory region by trained staff. Promotes tissue healing.

phases.name: Weeks 9-12: Early Ridden Work
phases.description: Begin light ridden work at walk only. Prepare for return to normal activity.

tasks.instructions: Light rider only. Walk work in arena on good surface. Build to 30 mins by week 12.
Larger paddock permitted. Still individual. Captain has earned his grass time.
Water treadmill for low-impact conditioning. Captain takes to water work brilliantly.
Full lameness evaluation at walk and trot in-hand. Document for vet review.

invoices.notes: Outstanding balance from October - please settle ASAP
Month 1 of Captain Comeback's rehabilitation. Care supplement charges submitted to insurance.

line_items.description: Care Plan Supplement - Operation Captain's Return (4 weeks)

invoices.notes: Month 2 of Captain Comeback's rehabilitation. Care supplement insurance claim reference: INS-2024-CC-002.

line_items.description: Care Plan Supplement - Operation Captain's Return (4 weeks)

invoices.notes: INSURANCE CLAIM STATEMENT - Month 1. Policy: EP-123456. Claim Ref: INS-2024-CC-001. Insurer: Equine Protect Ltd. Paid by insurer 15th of previous month.
INSURANCE CLAIM STATEMENT - Month 2. Policy: EP-123456. Claim Ref: INS-2024-CC-002. Insurer: Equine Protect Ltd. Submitted for payment.

holiday_livery_requests.special_requirements: Needs slow feeder hay net. Can be a bit spooky with tractors. Gets along well with other horses but prefers mares. Currently on joint supplement (Cortaflex) - will bring supply.
holiday_livery_requests.message: Hi! We're relocating to the area and need somewhere for Whiskey while we sort out permanent accommodation. He's a sweetheart - 16.2hh, been there done that type. Very easy to manage. Would love a stable with a view if possible!
holiday_livery_requests.admin_notes: Called to discuss - seems genuine. Waiting for vaccination records.

holiday_livery_requests.special_requirements: Ex-racehorse, now retired. Very calm and sensible. Needs soaked hay due to previous respiratory issues. Companion for owner's other horse who will be staying locally during their holiday.
holiday_livery_requests.message: Looking for holiday livery while we're in Portugal for 2 weeks. Charlie is an absolute gem - 15.3hh, retired racer, bombproof. He's the best. Can I book a call to discuss?
holiday_livery_requests.admin_notes: Lovely chap. Paid deposit. Vaccination records received and verified.

holiday_livery_requests.special_requirements: Elderly mare, needs extra TLC. On Cushing's medication (Prascend) daily. Owner will supply. Good doer - needs restricted grazing. Sweet natured but can be grumpy with young horses.
holiday_livery_requests.message: Princess B needs a holiday home while I have surgery. She's 18 but still going strong! Would need someone to administer her daily tablet hidden in an apple. She knows all the tricks so you have to be crafty!
holiday_livery_requests.admin_notes: Need to confirm we can handle Cushing's medication. Check with Daisy.

holiday_livery_requests.special_requirements: STALLION - experienced handlers only. Well mannered but still a stallion. Needs individual turnout. Currently competing at Medium dressage. Owner wants him kept in light work if possible.
holiday_livery_requests.message: Need emergency cover for Thunder - our yard has had a fire (everyone safe!) and we need temporary accommodation urgently. He's a stallion but incredibly well behaved. Happy to pay premium rates.
holiday_livery_requests.admin_notes: Unfortunately we don't have suitable facilities for stallions at present.
holiday_livery_requests.rejection_reason: We're sorry but we don't currently have appropriate facilities to safely accommodate stallions. We'd recommend contacting Highfield Stud on 01234 567890 who specialize in stallion accommodation.

holiday_livery_requests.special_requirements: Native type - good doer! Needs restricted grazing or track system. Currently on laminitis watch. Lovely temperament, great with children.
holiday_livery_requests.message: Family holiday to France booked! Daisy needs somewhere nice to stay. She's a total sweetheart - 14.2hh, does Pony Club with my daughter. Very easy, just needs watching for grass!
holiday_livery_requests.admin_notes: Perfect candidate for the track paddock. Pencil in for now.

rehab_task_logs.horse_response: Phoenix was keen to walk, needed reminding to keep it slow. Good energy.
Wound looking clean, slight redness around edges but improving.
rehab_task_logs.physical_observations: Wound edges slightly inflamed, minimal heat. No discharge. Surrounding tissue healthy.

rehab_task_logs.horse_response: Applied cream easily, Phoenix was very patient.
Lovely walk, Phoenix was a gentleman. Tried for treats at the end.
Wound checked, looking good. No heat or swelling.
rehab_task_logs.physical_observations: No heat detected. Inflammation reducing. Wound beginning to granulate nicely.

rehab_task_logs.horse_response: Cream applied, Phoenix stood nicely.
Good walk, Phoenix settling into the routine nicely.
Wound improving well, scab forming nicely.
rehab_task_logs.physical_observations: Healthy scab formation. No heat or swelling. Wound contracting well from edges.

rehab_task_logs.horse_response: Getting easier each day.
Phoenix was perfect. Walked nicely, no fuss.
Wound healing well, no concerns.
rehab_task_logs.physical_observations: Excellent healing progress. Scab intact and dry. Surrounding skin healthy.

rehab_task_logs.horse_response: Nice steady walk, Phoenix very relaxed.
Almost healed! Looking great.
rehab_task_logs.physical_observations: Scab beginning to lift at edges naturally. New pink skin visible underneath. No issues.

rehab_task_logs.horse_response: Phoenix getting stronger each day. Tried to trot once!
Wound nearly healed, just a small scab remaining.
rehab_task_logs.physical_observations: Small scab only. Healthy tissue regeneration. Will be fully healed within days.

rehab_task_logs.horse_response: Initial assessment post-incident. Black Beauty demonstrating impressive theatrical limping, switching legs occasionally.
rehab_task_logs.concerns: Mild lameness observed at trot, consistent on right hind. Muscle palpably tight over gluteal region.
rehab_task_logs.physical_observations: Right gluteal muscle tender to palpation. Slight heat detected. No swelling visible. Reduced hind end engagement at trot.

rehab_task_logs.horse_response: Administered bute paste. Black Beauty acted mortally wounded. The performance was Oscar-worthy.
Initial protests at heat pack application. Settled after 5 minutes and appeared to enjoy it. Nearly fell asleep.
rehab_task_logs.physical_observations: Muscle noticeably relaxed after heat therapy. Horse more comfortable standing square.

rehab_task_logs.horse_response: Morning check. Black Beauty moving better in stable. Still dramatic sighing when anyone walks past.
rehab_task_logs.physical_observations: Muscle still slightly tight but less reactive to touch. Heat reduced. Moving more freely at walk.

rehab_task_logs.horse_response: Morning bute given. Slightly less dramatic today. Progress!
Stood like a gentleman for heat therapy. Tried to eat the towel at the end.
rehab_task_logs.physical_observations: Good muscle relaxation response. No heat detected in affected area today.

rehab_task_logs.horse_response: Definite improvement! Black Beauty walked out of stable with minimal theatrical limping. Attempted to bolt from imaginary threat (leaf).
rehab_task_logs.physical_observations: Muscle tension significantly reduced. No heat. Walking sound, very mild inconsistency at trot - difficult to observe. Good progress.

rehab_task_logs.horse_response: Bute administered. Black Beauty accepted it with only minor complaints. We're entering the 'reluctant recovery' phase.
Heat therapy completed. Black Beauty very relaxed, leaning into the heat pack.
rehab_task_logs.physical_observations: Muscle feeling much looser. No tenderness on palpation. Expecting to progress well.

rehab_task_logs.horse_response: Captain walked beautifully, very steady pace. No rushing or excitement.
Stood perfectly for icing. The model patient.
rehab_task_logs.physical_observations: Minimal swelling in suspensory region. No heat detected.

rehab_task_logs.horse_response: Allowed thorough palpation. No pain response.
rehab_task_logs.physical_observations: Suspensory region firm but not hot. Comparison with contralateral limb shows reduced swelling. Good progress day 7.

rehab_task_logs.horse_response: Phase 1 final week. Captain moving well, very relaxed demeanor.
Excellent patient. Stood on three legs while we iced - total trust.
rehab_task_logs.physical_observations: No heat at all. Swelling minimal. Ready for phase 2 progression.

rehab_task_logs.horse_response: Phase 2 starts well. Extended walk time to 15 mins. Captain happy and forward.
First paddock turnout! Captain was sensible - walked around, had a roll, then grazed calmly.
Carrot stretches went well. Captain is very food motivated!
Building duration nicely. Captain walked 18 mins including gentle incline.
Post-exercise icing. Captain stood quietly.
rehab_task_logs.physical_observations: No heat post-exercise. Ligament region feeling good.

rehab_task_logs.horse_response: Weekly laser session. Captain very relaxed during treatment.
rehab_task_logs.physical_observations: Suspensory region responding well to cold laser treatment.

rehab_task_logs.horse_response: Week 6 going well. Full 20 minute walk with hill work.
Extended turnout time. Captain enjoying his paddock time sensibly.
Laser therapy completed. Captain dozed off during treatment!
rehab_task_logs.physical_observations: Excellent tissue condition. Vet pleased with progress at last check.

rehab_task_logs.horse_response: Continued excellent progress. Captain walks out well and is very eager.
Happy in paddock. Had a little canter (oops!) but settled quickly.
rehab_task_logs.concerns: Brief canter observed - monitored closely afterward. No adverse effects.

rehab_task_logs.horse_response: Pole work session went brilliantly. Core engagement improving.
rehab_task_logs.physical_observations: Much improved proprioception. Moving with better engagement behind.

rehab_task_logs.horse_response: Morning walk completed. Captain feeling very well!
Routine icing post-walk. Captain is a superstar.
rehab_task_logs.physical_observations: No heat, no swelling, no concerns. On track for phase 3.

rehab_task_logs.horse_response: Paddock turnout - sensible as always. Captain is ready for increased work.

contract_templates.name: Standard Livery Agreement
contract_templates.description: Our comprehensive livery agreement covering all terms and conditions for keeping your horse at Nags Rest Manor.

versions.html_content:
Standard Livery Agreement

Nags Rest Manor Equestrian Centre

This Agreement is entered into between Nags Rest Manor Equestrian Centre ("the Yard") and the undersigned horse owner ("the Client").

1. Services Provided

The Yard agrees to provide livery services for the Client's horse(s) as specified in the selected livery package. Services include:

  • Stable accommodation with bedding
  • Daily feeding according to the agreed schedule
  • Turnout as per package specifications
  • Access to arena facilities (hours as per package)
  • Basic daily health checks

2. Client Responsibilities

The Client agrees to:

  • Pay all fees on the 1st of each month
  • Maintain current vaccinations and worming
  • Provide emergency contact details
  • Notify staff of any health concerns promptly
  • Adhere to yard rules and safety guidelines

3. Liability

While every care is taken, the Yard cannot accept liability for injury to horses unless caused by negligence. All horses must be insured by their owners.

4. Termination

Either party may terminate this agreement with 30 days written notice.

By signing below, you agree to the terms and conditions set out in this agreement.

Standard Livery Agreement

Nags Rest Manor Equestrian Centre

This Agreement is entered into between Nags Rest Manor Equestrian Centre ("the Yard") and the undersigned horse owner ("the Client").

1. Services Provided

The Yard agrees to provide livery services for the Client's horse(s) as specified in the selected livery package. Services include:

  • Stable accommodation with bedding
  • Daily feeding according to the agreed schedule
  • Turnout as per package specifications
  • Access to arena facilities (hours as per package)
  • Basic daily health checks
  • NEW: Access to the rehabilitation facilities when available

2. Client Responsibilities

The Client agrees to:

  • Pay all fees on the 1st of each month
  • Maintain current vaccinations and worming
  • Provide emergency contact details
  • Notify staff of any health concerns promptly
  • Adhere to yard rules and safety guidelines
  • NEW: Maintain valid third-party liability insurance

3. Liability

While every care is taken, the Yard cannot accept liability for injury to horses unless caused by negligence. All horses must be insured by their owners.

4. Notice Period

UPDATED: Either party may terminate this agreement with 60 days written notice (previously 30 days).

5. Arena Booking

NEW: Arena bookings must be made at least 24 hours in advance. Cancellations with less than 4 hours notice may incur a charge.

By signing below, you agree to the terms and conditions set out in this agreement.
versions.change_summary: Added rehab facility access, third-party insurance requirement, increased notice period to 60 days, added arena booking policy

signatures.notes: Contract updated - re-signing required for new terms

contract_templates.name: Staff Employment Contract
contract_templates.description: Employment agreement for yard staff covering duties, pay, and working conditions.

versions.html_content:
Employment Contract

Nags Rest Manor Equestrian Centre

This contract of employment is between Nags Rest Manor Equestrian Centre ("the Employer") and the undersigned ("the Employee").

1. Position and Duties

The Employee is employed as a Yard Groom. Primary duties include:

  • Mucking out stables
  • Feeding horses according to schedules
  • Turning out and bringing in horses
  • General yard maintenance
  • Assisting with veterinary and farrier visits
  • Any other reasonable duties as required

2. Working Hours

Standard working hours are 40 hours per week, typically 8am-4pm with a 30-minute unpaid lunch break. Weekend work is required on rotation.

3. Remuneration

The Employee will receive the agreed hourly rate, paid monthly on the last working day of each month. Overtime is paid at time and a half.

4. Annual Leave

The Employee is entitled to 28 days paid annual leave per year (including bank holidays). Leave requests must be submitted via the yard management system.

5. Notice Period

Either party may terminate this employment with 4 weeks written notice.

6. Health and Safety

The Employee agrees to follow all health and safety procedures, wear appropriate PPE, and report any accidents or near-misses immediately.

By signing below, you confirm your acceptance of these terms of employment.

contract_templates.name: Holiday Livery Terms
contract_templates.description: Short-term agreement for temporary/holiday livery arrangements.

versions.html_content:
Holiday Livery Agreement

Nags Rest Manor Equestrian Centre

This agreement covers the temporary care of your horse during the agreed holiday period.

1. Period of Stay

This agreement covers the specific dates confirmed in your booking. Extensions require prior approval and may be subject to availability.

2. Services Included

  • Full livery care including feeding, turnout, and stable management
  • Daily health checks
  • Administration of routine medications if supplied
  • Emergency veterinary contact if required

3. Requirements

Owners must provide:

  • Up-to-date vaccination and worming records
  • Feed and medication requirements in writing
  • Emergency contact details
  • Proof of third-party liability insurance

4. Payment

Full payment is required before or on arrival. Weekly rate of £250 applies (pro-rata for part weeks).

5. Liability

Standard liability terms apply as per our main livery agreement. All horses must be insured.

By signing, you agree to these holiday livery terms and conditions.
